Key Match Events: The Rockies rallied from an 8-5 deficit to win the game with a five-run inning in the 8th
Others: The Cardinals hit four home runs, including back-to-back shots from Lars Nootbaar and Paul Goldschmidt in the first inning
Ivan Herrera added a solo homer in the 5th and Pedro Pages hit a two-run homer in the 8th
Victor Scott II got the start in center field and singled twice
The Cardinals were just 1-of-9 with runners in scoring position
Kyle Gibson made his final start of the season and allowed five runs over four innings
Steven Matz worked two scoreless innings in relief and John King and Fernandez worked a scoreless 7th before Fernandez and Leahy ran into their troubles in the 8th
Goldschmidt took over the team lead with his 22nd home run of the season
The Cardinals were trying to sweep a series in Colorado for the first time since 2004
The Cardinals also were trying to match their season-high five-game winning streak
Cardinals relievers combined had allowed only one run over six innings in the first two games of the series
This was the third time this season the Cardinals lost a game despite scoring eight or more runs (15-3 in those games)
The Cardinals will close out the season with three games this weekend against the Giants in San Francisco
